title: 10-year Left rule failed to ensure development of Kerala, alleges Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: The project to set up an AIIMS failed to become a reality in the State as the government did not acquire the land in Kozhikode, alleges Rajeev Chandrasekhar

title: Domestic tourism in Kerala soars, foreign arrivals remain tepid
content: Domestic tourism in Kerala reached a record 2.58 crore visitors in 2025, with local travelers accounting for 2.5 crore, marking a 12.46% increase from the previous year. In contrast, foreign tourist arrivals remain sluggish at 8.2 lakh, still below pre-pandemic levels.

title: Watch: Akhilesh Yadav alleges targeted theft of PDA votes during SIR
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav has alleged large-scale irregularities in the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Uttar Pradesh, claiming that names of SP supporters, particularly from PDA communities, are being selectively deleted.

title: Forests in Kerala dry up early raising wildfire threats
content: Climate change and lack of rainfall in February the main causes. Proliferation of invasive plant species another major factor

title: Way-Too-Early All-America team: Forecasting college football's top players in 2026
content: the Longhorns finished 10-3 last season and missed the college football Playoff . the 2026 Way-Too-Early All-America team is a tough position to pick just one player . quarterback arch Manning, receiver Cam Coleman and linebackers Colin Simmons and Rasheem Biles are on the team .

title: New record! China laps up discounted Russian crude as India reduces purchases
content: Supplies of Urals, along with other export grades such as Sokol and Varandey, have added to regular shipments of Russia‚Äôs flagship ESPO blend exported from the Far East port of Kozmino, which is geographically closer to China.

title: The Godfather fame Robert Duvall passes away at 95; wife Luciana Duvall confirms his demise
content: Veteran Hollywood star Robert Duvall, known for his iconic performances in The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95. His death on Sunday was confirmed by his wife, Luciana Duvall, on Monday.

title: Maha CM Fadnavis stays minority tags issued hours after Ajit Pawar's death
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has stayed minority status certificates for at least 75 educational institutes following allegations of irregularities. The decision came after opposition members demanded an inquiry into how these certificates were issued so quickly after the death of then-deputy CM Ajit Pawar.

title: CEO of European company that was forced to sell its American business this year has a warning
content: Capgemini CEO Aiman Ezzat cautions against unchecked AI adoption, warning of wasted investments due to 'FOMO'. He advocates for a balanced approach, emphasizing gradual progress and experimentation over hasty implementation. Ezzat stresses that AI should drive significant business disruption, not just operational efficiency, and highlights the crucial need for human-AI integration and trust.

title: India moves to stop Ravi waters to Pak as Shahpur Kandi dam nears finish
content: India is set to redirect surplus Ravi river water, previously flowing into Pakistan, to its own drought-prone regions once the Shahpur Kandi dam becomes operational. This significant move, expected by March 31, will irrigate vast areas in Punjab and Jammu & Kashmir, marking a strategic shift in water resource management following a policy change regarding the Indus Waters Treaty.

title: 'He bailed the team out': Gavaskar reveals turning point of India vs Pakistan clash
content: Sunil Gavaskar praised Suryakumar Yadav's astute match awareness following India's dominant T20 World Cup win over Pakistan. Gavaskar highlighted Suryakumar's crucial innings against both the USA and Pakistan, emphasizing his ability to anchor the batting and stabilize the innings under pressure. This strategic approach proved vital in securing India's victory and a Super 8 spot.

title: 'Don't lecture us, you can go...': Pentagon's warning to Anthropic
content: The Pentagon is reportedly considering ending its partnership with AI firm Anthropic over restrictions on military use of its technology. Anthropic refuses to allow its AI for mass surveillance of citizens or fully autonomous weapons, frustrating defense officials. While other companies are more accommodating, Anthropic's firm stance on ethical guardrails could lead to a complete termination of their collaboration.

title: Food, faith, and fight: Afghanistan‚Äôs pressure playbook at the T20 World Cup
content: Far from home comforts and craving Afghan food, Afghanistan‚Äôs cricketers are learning to cope with emotional and on-field pressure. A team dinner of Peshawari food helped them process the heartbreak of a double Super Over loss against South Africa, while growing resilience in crunch moments powered them over the line vs UAE, keeping their slim T20 World Cup Super Eight hopes alive.

title: From 'chaiwala' to 'Rahulian': Aiyar returns with a roar; Cong ducks for cover, again
content: Mani Shankar Aiyar has once again embarrassed the Congress with his remarks, first praising Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and then dismissing the party's leadership, including spokesperson Pawan Khera. The Congress has distanced itself from Aiyar, stating he has no connection with the party. This incident follows a pattern of Aiyar's controversial statements that have previously aided the BJP.

title: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife MacKenzie Scott on her inspiration for huge donations
content: MacKenzie Scott attributes her philanthropic approach to early acts of kindness, recalling a college roommate's loan and a dentist's free care. Since 2020, she has donated approximately 58 million Amazon shares, totaling billions through her Yield Giving organization, which supports diverse causes like education and DEI.

title: Nissanka ton powers Sri Lanka into Super 8; Australia on brink of elimination
content: Pathum Nissanka's unbeaten century powered Sri Lanka to an eight-wicket victory over Australia, securing their Super Eight spot in the T20 World Cup. Nissanka's brilliant 100 not out off 52 balls anchored the chase after Australia posted 181. Australia now faces elimination if Zimbabwe defeats Ireland.

title: The weight-loss shot everyone wants: Who should actually be taking Mounjaro and Wegovy?
content: Weight loss injections, once for diabetes, are now trending as beauty hacks. Experts warn these prescription drugs, like Mounjaro and Wegovy, are for medically supervised obesity management, not cosmetic use. They're for individuals with a high BMI or related health issues who haven't succeeded with lifestyle changes. Careful doctor consultation is crucial, as certain medical histories preclude their use.

title: Cardi B confirms breakup with Stefon Diggs while defending him on tour
content: Rapper Cardi B confirmed her breakup with NFL player Stefon Diggs during a concert. She publicly defended Diggs against rapper BIA's online remarks. This happened after Diggs's Super Bowl performance. Cardi B stated Diggs remains family despite their split. The couple had unfollowed each other on social media earlier. Speculation about cheating allegations also surfaced.

title: NHL trade rumour: Bruins eye three blue-line targets
content: Boston Bruins are reportedly eyeing three defensemen to bolster their blue line before the March 2026 NHL trade deadline.  Justin Faulk, Zach Whitecloud, and Braden Schneider are emerging as key targets to strengthen the team's right side.  The Bruins aim to acquire a top-four defenseman to fill a crucial role.

title: Kurt Van Dyke slain in Costa Rica; girlfriend survives attack
content: American hotel owner Kurt Van Dyke was killed during a robbery at an apartment in Cahuita, Costa Rica. Police say armed suspects tied up his girlfriend, stole valuables, and fled in stolen vehicles. Reports from The Tico Times and Surfer.com confirmed key details. Van Dyke, linked to a historic California surfing family, had lived in Costa Rica for years.

title: Maduro's gone ‚Äî But is Venezuela witnessing a new 'Don'?
content: Venezuela is in a new political phase after President Nicolas Maduro's removal. Delcy Rodriguez now leads an interim administration. Diplomatic ties with Washington are restoring. The oil sector is opening to private operators. Hundreds of detainees have been released. However, the security apparatus remains. Elections are not yet announced. Key figures of the old establishment continue in power.

title: From Moran to Mach 2.8: Inside IAF's night-ready war machines
content: India has opened a new emergency landing strip in Assam. This facility is part of a larger plan to create multiple air bases across the country. The move enhances India's air power and survivability. It signals a strategic shift in defense doctrine. This development strengthens India's readiness for modern warfare scenarios.

title: Ameesha Patel faces non-bailable warrant in Rs 4.5 lakh cheque case
content: Legal trouble has resurfaced for Ameesha Patel as a Moradabad court issued a non-bailable warrant against her in connection with a 2017 event dispute. The order came after the actress allegedly failed to appear despite multiple summons issued by the court.

title: The hidden MAGA message in Marco Rubio's 'civilisational erasure' warning to Europe
content: ‚ÄãSince his return from political exile ‚Äî something even Napoleon couldn‚Äôt do ‚Äî Trump has gone out of his way to treat Europe the way it once treated the rest of world: like a body bag without impunity.

title: India's exports to US plunge 22% as imports surge sharply
content: According to GTRI, the latest trade figures for January 2026 reflect the significant impact of US tariffs on India‚Äôs export performance, while also indicating early signs of diversification into other markets.

title: Rajpal Yadav's brother reacts after the Delhi HC grants him bail: 'Our good days are yet to come'
content: Rajpal Yadav has been granted interim bail by the Delhi High Court until March 18 to attend his niece's wedding, following his surrender in a Rs 9 crore debt and cheque bounce case. The actor's brother expressed no complaints, stating good days are yet to come. Yadav's manager confirmed a press conference is planned soon to address the controversy.

title: Hydration myths exposed: The hidden dangers to your kidneys
content: Kidneys require consistent, moderate hydration, not just when thirsty.  Sipping sugary or caffeinated drinks doesn't suffice, and overhydration can be harmful.  Dr. Ajay Aggarwal highlights that both too little and too much fluid can damage these vital organs.  Monitoring urine color is key to finding the right balance for optimal kidney health.

title: Ramadan Mubarak 2026: Top 50 Ramzan wishes, messages, quotes and more
content: Ramadan 2026 begins around February 18-19 in India, marking a period of fasting, prayer, and reflection for Muslims. This sacred month, one of Islam's pillars, emphasizes spiritual growth and community. It culminates in Eid ul-Fitr on March 19-20, a joyous festival celebrating the end of the fast.

title: 'If Pakistan had won‚Ä¶': Kaif fires back at Shoaib Akhtar in fiery on-air moment
content: India secured a significant win against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup. Former player Mohammed Kaif believes the focus has been too much on Pakistan's struggles. He highlights India's skill and composure under immense pressure. Players like Ishan Kishan delivered outstanding performances. This victory demonstrates India's ability to perform when stakes are high.

title: Tamil Nadu: Congress vs Congress erupts as Stalin refuses to blink
content: Tamil Nadu's power-sharing debate has ignited friction between Congress and DMK, exposing internal Congress rifts. State leadership is silencing dissent, with TNCC chief rebuking MP Manickam Tagore for raising the issue publicly. CM Stalin firmly rejected power-sharing demands, calling them a conspiracy, while asserting alliance strength.

title: Designer rice on your plate soon? CSIR-NIIST transfers tech to private firms
content: CSIR‚ÄìNIIST is set to transfer its innovative designer rice technology, enriched with protein and micronutrients while boasting a lower glycaemic impact. This initiative aims to transform polished white rice into a healthier staple, with licenses granted to Tata Consumer Products Ltd and SS Soul Foods. The event will also see the transfer of other advanced technologies.

title: 'You have 5 years': Rajnath's 'challenge' for DRDO to develop 5th & 6th gen aero-engines
content: ‚ÄãSpeaking at the Gas Turbine Research Establishment in Bengaluru, defence minister Rajnath Singh said the establishment, functioning under the  DRDO, has become "the foundation of India's strategic capability," crediting its scientists for consistently delivering successful tests and strengthening the country's defence preparedness. Rajnath Singh acknowledged the deadline as a challenge; however, he said it should not come "as a shock or a surprise."‚Äã‚Äã

title: Trisha Krishnan issues legal warning over distasteful remarks and political linking
content: Actress Trisha Krishnan has issued a strong legal statement. She is slamming distasteful remarks and any linking to politics. Krishnan stated she wishes to be defined solely by her craft. She emphasized her neutral stance on political matters. The actress requested her name not be dragged into unrelated issues. Her privacy and professional identity deserve respect.

title: Watch: Drunk man naps on track as train stops inches away
content: A man, reportedly intoxicated, was found sleeping on a railway track at Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, halting Harbour Line services and delaying thousands of commuters. The incident, captured in a viral video, saw the train stop just in time, preventing a tragedy. Operations resumed after the man was safely removed.

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs X outage: Twitter down for thousands globally, including India
content: Elon Musk's social media platform X is experiencing a significant global technical outage, impacting thousands of users across the US, India, and Europe. Reports began surfacing around 7:10 PM on Monday, with users encountering blank timelines and error messages. Both mobile and desktop versions of the platform are affected by the widespread disruption.

title: JEE Main 2026 session 1 result released: Direct link to download here
content: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has declared the JEE Main 2026 Session 1 results on its official portals, jeemain.nta.ac.in and ntaresults.nic.in. Candidates can download their scorecards using their application number and date of birth. The results include percentile scores, All India Rank, category-wise rank, and subject-wise performance. Over 13 lakh students appeared, with the top 2.5 lakh eligible for JEE Advanced 2026. Session 2 is scheduled from April 2 to 9, 2026.

title: 'Terrible mistake': Pakistan's big blunder vs India exposed
content: Ravichandran Ashwin criticised Pakistan's decision to bowl first after winning the toss in their T20 World Cup loss to India, deeming it the match's turning point. He highlighted Pakistan's tactical errors, including bowling choices and pressure handling, as key factors in their defeat.

title: 'Is he a ghost?' How a spirit found a place in my pooja room and became our God
content: In a village pooja room, a Brahmin family worshipped not only deities but also a guardian spirit, Ranga Dhari, and a local Sufi saint, Pir Baba. This layered faith, blending Hindu and Sufi traditions, reflected a deep connection to land, family, and protection, where a 'ghost' was revered as a protector. The sacred space held history and inheritance, not contradiction.

title: CBSE releases notice ahead of board exams: Warns of strict action over fake paper leak claims
content: CBSE Class X and XII board examinations begin on February 17, 2026, with the Board issuing a strong warning against fake question paper leak claims on social media. The Central Board of Secondary Education has urged students and parents to ignore rumours, rely only on official sources, and assured strict security measures for fair conduct.

title: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda reception invite goes viral after wedding buzz
content: Speculation is rife as reports suggest Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna are set to marry on February 26, with a destination wedding in Udaipur and a Hyderabad reception on March 4. A viral invite, though unconfirmed, hints at a celebration with loved ones.

title: J&K LG orders reopening of 14 more tourist spots restricted after April 2025 Pahalgam attack
content: jammu and Kashmir LG Manoj Sinha ordered the reopening of 14 tourist spots that were closed in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack 10 months ago . Eleven of the 14 tourists to be opened immediately are in Kashmir Valley ‚Äî yousmarg, Doodhpathri and Dandipora Park in Anantnag; Peer Ki Gali, Dubjan and Padpawan in Shopian; Astanpora and Tulip Garden in Srinagar; Thaj

title: Pak duo among 3 inmates flee Jammu juvenile home after injuring 2 cops
content:
The assault was captured on CCTV camera

JAMMU: Three inmates of a juvenile observation home, including two Pakistani nationals, fled custody after allegedly attacking and injuring two policemen posted on guard duty at the facility in RS Pura area in Jammu district on Monday evening. After escaping the observation home around 5.15pm, the trio allegedly robbed a bike at gunpoint and left RS Pura, said sources. Police launched a massive hunt to trace the fugitives. Special security points were set up en route to Samba district and in Jammu, said sources, claiming that the accused might leave for Samba to reach the national highway and exit the region. The injured cops, SPO Vinay Kumar and Head Constable Parveen Kumar, were hospitalised.

End of Article
